alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Gabriel Mountains; Eastern Santa Monica Mountains Recreational Area; Interstate 5 Corridor; Northern Ventura County Mountains; Santa Susana Mountains; Southern Ventura County Mountains; Western San Gabriel Mountains and Highway 14 Corridor; Western Santa Monica Mountains Recreational Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued November 09 at 8:53AM PST until November 09 at 6:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THROUGH 6 PM TODAY FOR MOST MOUNTAIN AND VALLEY AREAS OF LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTIES AS WELL AS THE MALIBU COAST DUE TO GUSTY SANTA ANA WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .Gusty Santa Ana winds and low humidities will impact portions of Los Angeles and Ventura counties today. Northeast winds will peak later this morning, then gradually decrease through Friday. Humidity levels will gradually lower as well. As a result, there is a 40 percent chance of reaching six or more hours of critical low humidity and gusty wind combinations. There is a 10 percent chance of red flag conditions to linger in the windiest areas Thursday night into Friday. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM PST THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FOR THE MOUNTAINS OF LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTIES... * WINDS...North to northeast 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 45 mph. Isolated gusts to 60 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Falling to 8 to 18 percent. * Impacts...If fire ignition occurs there could be rapid spread of wildfire that would lead to a threat to life and property.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. Use extreme caution with anything that can spark a wildfire. Residents near wildland interfaces should be prepared to evacuate if a wildfire breaks out. See readyforwildfire.org and wildfirerisk.org for information.
